intro: Alibertia triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered alibertia, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its fragrant, small white to yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in threes. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a rough texture. Alibertia triflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
